content.description: The climb is a bit hidden by foliage, but starts basically at trail level.Start by stemming in a corner up to the first bolt. Then climb steeper face for a couple bolts to a slabby section at the top.There  is a bit of crumbly rock left of the third bolt. It is not in play and not needed, Just warning you.

Climb right side of face. Gain initial start edge and first bolt. Approach from right side of first bolt with high steps. locate mono and move over first bolt to the jug at the second bolt. The belayer must be VERY diligent. Move left to second bolt. Easy 3rd bolt then delicate moves up and left(sometimes damp). Pull small overlap and finish on Samurai anchors

 Cutter Variation. Climb directly up to 2nd bolt. start about 5' left of the 1st bolt (10c).
content.protection: 8 or so bolts with shared anchor
content.location: About 1.95 miles on the trail.   Small SW face with three routes.

content.description: Begin with a bouldery move below 1st bolt (optional) right of Namaste. Pull up right onto a large ledge and 2nd bolt. A Few easier moves up and right to the third bolt. Powerful moves with tricky feet up the crack clipping 2 bolts along the way. Finish on Namaste (last 2 bolts).

Climb slab left ofLeal al Lubricante Jiffy. Get to first high bolt via trivial climbing. Move up to bolt 2 and slightly left for bolt 3. There is some junk rock to the left, so don't go too far that way. At third bolt make a devious sequence of moves right to a bomber side pull and 4th bolt. Stem the remaining route to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and 2 bolt anchor.The route really isn't that PG13, but there is a possibility of small ledges turning an ankle when falling at the wrong place.
content.location: Just left of Leal al Lubricante Jiffy

content.description: Climb easy ground to first high bolt. Then straight up to anchors
content.location: Just to the right of Iechyd Da

content.description: Start left of first bolt. Follow ramp up and right to steep wall.   Move over bulge on good holds to inside corner. Follow Corner to its end and step left to anchor.   Put extended draw/sling on next to last bolt before anchors b/c that bolt is kinda far right.

Start on left side of face.    There are two starts either lay back corner to first bolt or move directly up to first bolt.   Aim for under cling horn/jug below third bolt. Lay back discontinuous crack on steep terrain with thin feet/swap. The climb eases off after 4th bolt. A nice test piece for aspiring 8 leaders.
content.location: About 1.95 miles on the trail.   Small SW face with three routes.

climbs.name: Mi Nombre es Seth, y me pierdo a bailar

content.description: Climb slab starting on stance on Gusta Bailar's 5th bolt then stay on the right side of remaining bolt line
content.protection: 8 bolts and 2 bolt anchor shared with Bailar

climbs.name: Me llamo John, Me gusta mucho bailar.

content.description: Climb slabby edge up and right gaining stance. From stance dance up the crack to anchors

Work up past an easy sloping ledge to the first bolt. Use the Jugs left of the tree and face holds with consistent difficulty to reach the anchors. 3rd bolt may be hard to reach, have the taller climber lead first. Do not get sucked too far right after the second bolt, it gets chossy. The climb itself stays shaded until about noon, but your belayer will be in the sun long before then.
content.protection: 4 bolts on route, 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: The leaning slabs about 100ft south of Arrampicano.

content.description: Harder than it looks climbing up a thin slab passing 3 bolts, Some tricky moves just before the anchors to a thanks goodness jug.
content.location: A short slab with 2 climbs. It is 20' right of ubuntu.This is the left most climb of the 2.

content.description: Start at large tree. Climb up right using underclings and lie backs. Next move straight up on small features gaining shallow pockets. Move up to anchors
content.protection: A bunch of bolts. Prolly too many.

content.description: Climb the corner left of Jiffy Lube Loyal, using the blocky overhang and smeary slab. TR from Jiffy Lube's anchors. Could be led on gear if corner cleaned out.
content.protection: Trad, Shared anchors with Jiffy Lube Loyal

content.description:
Climb middle of face.   Climb strait up the middle on steeper rock with side pulls and kinda cracks with bad feet.   Climb eases after first 25 feet. 

  This climb has amazing movement!
content.location: About 1.95 miles on the trail.   Small SW face with three routes.

content.description: Large cliff at 2.0 mile marker on trail.   Climb flakes to big "V".   Move right on steep slab.   gain steeper rock with cracks.
Just left of Namaste there is a small ridge about 20' tall to a crack.Move right on slanting ledge. Then follow a finger crack up and right to the anchors on Namaste.
Tall thin section of rock at the 2 mile marker.   The top 50' pitch is tradable.
